author: Sarath Babu George
text:
Says Vemula’s ‘farewell note’ a testament to the current times

Terming the controversy surrounding Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) tragic, Gopalkrishna Gandhi, former diplomat and grandson of Mahatma Gandhi, has called for restoring the original ambience of free thought and expression on the campus of the prestigious university.

“The delicate balance between reason and emotion is under strain in society. This is also reflected among the student community. It is essential that students have a sense of fearlessness and freedom for expressing their thoughts. This should go beyond the curriculum and extend to the state of society and nation,” Mr. Gandhi told The Hindu on the sidelines of a function here on Monday. The former Governor of West Bengal also stressed the need for political leaders to counsel students against extreme and violent thoughts. He held the view that student organisations themselves should practise the balance between freedom of thought and expressions and responsible speech. Pointing out that education and politics had always gone hand-in-hand since the days of the freedom struggle, Mr. Gandhi said that students had to carefully select the kind of politics they wanted to practise. Referring to the tragic death of research scholar Rohith Vemula, Mr. Gandhi said the episode went beyond universities and politics to pose existential questions about the country.

“In present-day India, individuals have become digits and numbers. This form of digitization of the Indian mind should be countered at all costs,” he said.

He added that Rohith’s ‘farewell note’ was a testament to the current times and had many layers to it.
title: Restore original ambience of JNU: Gopalkrishna Gandhi
